Types

Arbitrary[T] = object
  mgenerate: ArbitraryImpl[T]
  shrink: ShrinkImpl[T]
  kind: ArbitraryKind
arbitrary value arbitrary for some type T
XXX: eventually migrate to concepts once they're more stable, but
language stability is the big reason for making this whole property based testing framework.
  Source   Edit 
ArbitraryImpl[T] = proc (a: Arbitrary[T]; mrng: var Random): Shrinkable[T]
  Source   Edit 
ArbitraryKind = enum
  akLarge,                  ## infeasilbe to generate all possible values (most cases)
  akExhaustive               ## possible to generate all values (bool, enums, 8 bit ints)
  Source   Edit 
Frequency = int
future use to allow specification of biased generation   Source   Edit 
PossibleRunId = int
separate from RunId to support 0 value, indicating non-specified   Source   Edit 
Predicate[T] = proc (s: T): PTStatus
test function to see if a property holds   Source   Edit 
Property[T] = object
  arb: Arbitrary[T]
  predicate: Predicate[T]
a condition that must hold for an arbitrary as specified by a predicate   Source   Edit 
PTStatus = enum
  ptPreCondFail, ptFail, ptPass
the result of a single run/predicate check XXX: likely to be changed to a variant to support, true/false/error+data   Source   Edit 
Random = object
  seed: uint32
  rng: MersenneTwister
  calls: uint                ## number of calls
random number arbitrary, allows abstraction over algorithm   Source   Edit 
RunId = range[1 .. high(int)]
sequential id of the run, starts from 1   Source   Edit 
Shrinkable[T] = object
  value*: T
future support for shrinking   Source   Edit 
ShrinkImpl[T] = proc (value: Shrinkable[T]): seq[Shrinkable[T]]
  Source   Edit

noRunId = 0

proc arbitrary[T](mgenerate: ArbitraryImpl[T]; shrink: ShrinkImpl[T] = nil;
                  kind: ArbitraryKind = akLarge): Arbitrary[T]
  Source   Edit 
proc asShrinkable[T](v: sink T): Shrinkable[T]
Construct new shinkable entry, copying value   Source   Edit 
func asStatus(b: bool): PTStatus {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Non-converter alternative to toPTStatus. Maybe converter should be exported, maybe not, but having simple proc for that purpose is useful.   Source   Edit 
proc filter[T](o: Arbitrary[T]; predicate: proc (t: T): bool): Arbitrary[T]
creates a new Arbitrary with filtered values, aggressive filters can lead to exhausted values.   Source   Edit 
proc filter[T](s: Shrinkable[T]; predicate: proc (t: T): bool): Shrinkable[T]
  Source   Edit 
proc flatMap[T, U](s: Arbitrary[T]; fmapper: proc (t: T): Arbitrary[U]): Arbitrary[
    U]
creates a new Arbitrary for every value produced by s. For when you want to make the value of an Arbitrary depend upon the value of another.   Source   Edit 
proc generate[T](a: Arbitrary[T]; mrng: var Random): Shrinkable[T]
calls the internal implementation   Source   Edit

proc startRun(r: var RunId): RunId {.discardable, inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
marks the current run as complete and returns the preivous RunId   Source   Edit
